turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Moscow State University.
turn.1: When was the first day that Moscow State University was open as a university?
turn.2: The present Moscow State University originally occupied the Principal Medicine Store on Red Square from 1755 to 1787. Catherine the Great transferred the University to a Neoclassical building on the other side of Mokhovaya Street; that main building was constructed between 1782 and 1793 in the Neo-Palladian style, to a design by Matvei Kazakov, and rebuilt by Domenico Giliardi after the fire consumed much of Moscow in 1812.
turn.3: What were the different courses of study that were offered?
turn.4: In the 18th century, the University had three departments: philosophy, medicine, and law.
turn.5: Did the university prepare students for college?
turn.6: A preparatory college was affiliated with the University until its abolition in 1812.
turn.7: Who were the students that were enrolled?
turn.8: In 1779, Mikhail Kheraskov founded a boarding school for noblemen (Благородный пансион) which in 1830 became a gymnasium for the Russian nobility.
turn.9: Did the University have a newspaper?
turn.10: The university press, run by Nikolay Novikov in the 1780s, published the most popular newspaper in Imperial Russia: "Moskovskie Vedomosti".
turn.11: Did any other interesting things happen at the University?
turn.12: In 1804, medical education split into clinical (therapy), surgical, and obstetrics faculties.
